Intervention: Patients only receive chemotherapy containing cyclophosphamide.
Cyclophosphamide: part of the intended therapeutic regimen

Patients receive goséréline subcutaneously once every 4 weeks from one week before the start of chemotherapy containing cyclophosphamide. Treatment continues until chemotherapy is completed in the absence of disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.
Cyclophosphamide: part of the intended therapeutic regimen
Eligibility: Invasive bilateral synchronous breast cancer is allowed provided that primary tumours are not diagnosed more than one month apart and both tumours are negative hormonal receptors.
3 to 8 months of pre-operative or post-operative chemotherapy containing alkylants (anthracyclines or non-anthracyclines) should be provided, meeting 1 of the following criteria:
Treatment with anthracycline at 3 months and 4 months
Fertile patients should use effective contraception against barriers.

No other prior cancer, except skin cancer of properly treated basal cells or squamous cells, or in situ cancer of which the patient has not been ill for at least 5 years after treatment with curative intent.
- Concomitant radiotherapy in the breast, chest wall or lymph nodes is permitted
• Simultaneous participation in other therapeutic clinical trials, including SWOG-S0221, is permitted
Results: Premature ovarian failure rate at 2 years

- Ovarian insufficiency at two years is defined as amenorrhoea (no menstrual bleeding) for the previous six months AND the presence of follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH) in the postmenopausal interval.
Title of the arm/group: Standard chemotherapy
Description arm/group: Patients receive chemotherapy containing cyclophosphamide alone.
Cyclophosphamide: part of the intended therapeutic regimen
Type of measure: Number of participants
Title of the arm/group: Chemotherapy More Goserelin

Description arm/group: Patients receive goséréline subcutaneously once every 4 weeks from one week before the start of chemotherapy containing cyclophosphamide. Treatment continues until chemotherapy is completed in the absence of disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.
Cyclophosphamide: part of the intended therapeutic regimen
Type of measure: Number of participants
